The text describes an invention for dental cleaning and massaging apparatus. The invention provides for hydraulic cleaning of teeth and massaging of gums, which research shows is more effective than traditional brushing, toothpicks, or dental floss. The apparatus consists of a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members, membranes, bite blocks, air-sacks, and hoses for water and air. The upper and lower channel members fit over the teeth and snugly against the gums, and are made of a relatively soft but semi-rigid material with holes for air flow. A first outer membrane extends from the upper to lower channel members, and a second inner membrane encloses the area between them, forming a sealed area. Air-sacks along the hose expand when inflated, causing upper and lower channel members to massage gums while teeth stay in place with bite blocks. Water or cleaning fluid is introduced through the mouthpiece to clean teeth and gums, while suction hoses remove excess fluid from the mouth.

* The present invention relates to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants and provides a reliable anchoring mechanism for mesh implants during surgery.
* The invention includes a needle with a trap for trapping a strap while the needle is at the accessible side of the tissue, a tip for threading the trapped strap from the accessible side to the opposing side, and a mechanism for releasing the trap from the accessible side, allowing the tip to return to the accessible side while abandoning the strap at the threaded point.
* The needle's trap consists of a niche for inserting an end of the implant strap and a rod for grasping the end of the strap. The niche is located near the tip, and the end of the strap may have a looped end for inserting the rod.
* The anterior implant includes straps threaded into the arcus tendineous fascia pelvic (ATFP) ligaments and sacrospinous (SS) ligaments, and a loop between the second straps for anchoring to the cervix. It can be used for reconstructing organs such as the urinary bladder, colon, and small intestine.
* The posterior implant includes straps threaded into the sacrospinous ligaments, a first loop between the straps for anchoring to the cervix, and a second loop at the opposing side for anchoring to the perineal body. It can be used for reconstructing organs such as the colon, small intestine, and uterus.
* The method for using a needle to thread a strap through a surface involves trapping an end of the strap while the needle is at the accessible side of the surface tissue, threading the needle and trapped strap through the surface, releasing the trap from the accessible side, and returning the needle to the accessible side while abandoning the strap at the threaded point. The trapping step includes inserting the end of the strap into a niche and grasping it with a rod, and grasping can also involve applying physical force on the end of the strap towards the limiting wall in the niche. Releasing the trap involves removing the rod from the end of the strap. The invention also includes methods for installing anterior and posterior implants using these needles.

• The text describes a method and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance to subjects with respiratory needs, suitable for both spontaneously and non-spontaneously breathing individuals.
• The invention addresses the challenges of matching mask pressure to a subject's respiratory needs, especially during sleep, and in the presence of leaks or changes in respiratory control.
• The text outlines the background of the problem, including the limitations of existing ventilatory devices and the need for a device that can adapt to a subject's changing respiratory needs.
• The invention aims to meet three goals: closely matching the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts, automatically adjusting the degree of assistance to maintain a minimum ventilation, and providing some immunity to the effects of sudden leaks.
• The text introduces a method for calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable, using identifiable features of a prototype flow-vs-time waveform and fuzzy logic.
• The invention also includes a method for calculating the average respiratory rate, which involves low pass filtering the instantaneous rate of change of phase and measuring leak-corrected respiratory airflow.
• The method for providing ventilatory assistance involves calculating the instantaneous phase, selecting a desired waveform template function, and calculating a desired instantaneous delivery pressure based on the phase and desired waveform.
• The text also describes an alternative embodiment that is particularly applicable to subjects with varying respiratory mechanics, insufficient respiratory drive, abnormal chemoreceptor reflexes, hypoventilation syndromes, or Cheyne Stokes breathing.
• The apparatus for the second embodiment includes a blower, mask, pneumotachograph, differential pressure transducer, microprocessor, motor servo, and communications port.
• The text outlines the initialization process, which involves setting user-adjustable parameters, calculating expected respiratory cycle duration, and setting standard rates of change of phase during inspiration and expiration.

• The invention describes an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for use in laparoscopic procedures, which includes a rigid arm extending from the sleeve and laterally offset from its longitudinal axis, reducing obstruction of the surgeon's view of the working tip electrode and surgical work site.
• The instrument includes an electrical insulating layer along the entire length of the tool up to the exposed working tip electrode, eliminating inadvertent cauterization of healthy tissue with portions of the tool other than the working tip electrode.
• The distal end of the tool includes a rigid arm extending from the sleeve, with a working tip electrode formed at its free end, used to make direct contact with the patient at the internal operation site.
• The working tip electrode comes in various shapes, such as a hook or flattened spatula, depending on the needs of the surgeon in a particular surgical application.
• The arm and working tip electrode are formed of electrically conductive material and are supplied electrical energy via a conductive rod extending through the sleeve.
• The invention includes three embodiments of the electro-surgical instrument, each with a different arm configuration, allowing for maximum visualization of the working tip electrode and operation site by the surgeon.

• The present invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) apparatus with a magnet, patient receptacle, support plate, and transmit and receive coils for exposures in two predetermined positions with specific adjustment parameters.
• In known MRI apparatuses, adjustment parameters must be modified for different exposure positions, optimizing the RF chain and homogeneity of the main magnetic field.
• Adjustments can take place through spatial modification of the support plate or connection/disconnection of transmit and receive coils, but can take time and affect image quality or require multiple injections of contrast agent.
• The inventive MRI apparatus determines required adjustment parameters in a preceding adjustment process and executes exposures in a subsequent exposure process.
• Adjustment parameters include support plate position, transmit and receive coil configurations, and control signals for various components.
• Larger bodily segments can be examined with the inventive apparatus, such as in subtraction angiography or physiologically controlled imaging.
• The adjustment process precedes the exposure process, allowing for high-contrast exposures and reduced examination times without omitting adjustments or requiring multiple injections.
• The inventive solution is applicable to various forms of MRI apparatuses, including cylindrical and horseshoe magnets.

* The present invention relates to a new type of releasable fastener for albums with front and back covers and removable pages.
* It consists of a pair of strap anchors, a strap, and means for providing a releasable connection between the strap and each anchor.
* Each strap anchor is in the form of a channel with a snap lock to securely hold the strap.
* The strap is snap-locked into the channel by snapping engagement beneath locking lips at the open side of the channel.
* The base of the channel and the strap have inter-engaging formations to prevent longitudinal displacement of the strap.
* The strap enters the channel via an aperture bordered by a projection to ensure correct location between the strap anchor and the cover.
* The album can have at least two fasteners mounted along the spine part of the album, with the strap anchors attached to the respective covers.
* The strap anchors can be adhesively attached to the covers for easy installation.

<summary>
• The present invention is about a new design for a lightweight and durable sulky using light metals and other materials.
• The design allows for easy assembly from flat elements, saving space during storage and transportation.
• The sulky's shafts and crossbar transfer all load to the wheel planes, ensuring a stable construction.
• The end frames are casted from aluminum or similar light metals, while the crossbar is made of extruded aluminum.
• The crossbar is fastened to the mounting bushings in the end frames using simple threaded connections and deformable materials.
• The end frames are designed for easy casting and mass production, reducing manufacturing costs.
• The sulky has a weight reduction of approximately 40%, with a total weight of around 18 kg.
• The sulky can be easily assembled by the user using ordinary hand tools, with all connections becoming secure without any play.
</summary>

The present invention introduces a new design for a sulky that can be manufactured using lightweight and durable materials such as aluminum and other light metals. This design allows for easy assembly by the user from flat elements, saving space during storage and transportation. The shafts and crossbar transfer all load to the wheel planes, ensuring a stable construction. The end frames are casted using a chill-casting or press-casting process, while the crossbar is manufactured from extruded aluminum. The crossbar is fastened to the mounting bushings in the end frames using simple threaded connections and deformable materials, ensuring a secure and rigid frame. The end frames are designed for easy casting and mass production, reducing manufacturing costs. The sulky has a weight reduction of approximately 40%, with a total weight of around 18 kg in a ready-to-use state. Finally, the sulky can be easily assembled by the user using ordinary hand tools, with all connections becoming secure without any play.

* The present invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds in water-cooled generators, specifically addressing the issue of air bubbles accumulating in rotating pipes.
* The invention provides at least one bypass with inlets and outlets between the feed and discharge ducts, with inlets opening into the space around the axis of rotation.
* The advantages of the invention include automatic removal of bubbles using the pressure gradient between inflow and outflow, and a relatively simple design.
* Preferred embodiments include bypasses arranged in end faces of feed ducts, radially arranged pipe members, and coiled pipes with increased hydrodynamic resistance.
* The bypasses enable bubbles to be transported from the area of lowest pressure around the axis of rotation into the discharge duct, improving cooling system efficiency.
* The invention can be embodied in various ways while still achieving the inventive principles, including different arrangements of feed and discharge ducts and bypass designs.

* The invention relates to a steering column for motor vehicles with a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft and a retaining part. The jacket unit is secured non-displaceably to the retaining part up to a limit value of force acting parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft. If the limit value is exceeded, the jacket unit becomes displaceable parallel to the longitudinal axis in the direction toward the motor vehicle front.
* The invention includes a steering column with an elastic prestress exerted onto at least one bending wire or strip, which decreases the force peak during the breaking away of the jacket unit from the retaining part and provides a stable connection in normal driving operation. The steering column is adjustable in length and has a securement device with a clamp bolt and securement parts that engage with the retaining part.
* The energy absorption connection between the jacket unit and the retaining part is realized through a bending wire or strip that is deformed during the dislocation of the jacket unit. The bending wire or strip is enclosed in a housing formed by a portion of the jacket unit and is connected with the retaining part across a break-away connection. The break-away connection can be formed by a pin or a frictional closure connection.

<summary>
• The present invention is a method for installing flat uncontoured glass in curved window openings of vehicles.
• Objective is to provide an economical and inexpensive process for installing curved glass windows.
• In the prior art, pre-contoured glass is used, which becomes less flexible and more brittle during the contouring process.
• Flat glass is less rigid and more flexible, making it less likely to shatter in a vehicular accident.
• The present invention uses a flat glass panel that is flexed in situ to conform to the curved window opening.
• A holding means, including resilient clips and a reveal molding, is used to engage and maintain the glass in the curved window opening.
• The glass is flexed outwardly against the reveal molding to apply adhesive sealant between the glass and the window opening.
• The adhesive cures and permanently holds the glass in place within the window opening in its conforming curvature.
• The fastening means comprises a plurality of resilient clips and a reveal molding that presses on the outer surface of the glass, pushing it into conforming engagement with the bay of the window opening.
• The flat glass is less expensive than pre-contoured glass, making the overall cost to the consumer significantly less.
</summary>

* The invention provides a mechanical, cylindrical gas scavenger machine for removing oxygen from water on floating offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms, reducing the height and cost compared to conventional stripping towers.
* The apparatus includes a vessel with gasification chambers, each with a mechanism for ingesting and mixing a second gas to displace the first gas (oxygen) to the vapor space, and a vent for removing the displaced gas. The second gas, such as nitrogen, physically displaces the first gas according to Henry's Law, allowing for the desired reduction in oxygen concentration.

<summary>
• The text describes a packaging machine with a rotational shaft and transfer mechanisms for converting the rotational movement into the movement required to operate movable tool members at various work stations.
• The shaft drives tool members of multiple work stations, resulting in synchronized movements and a simpler, more compact design.
• The transfer mechanisms can be toggle levers or cam mechanisms, and may include wear-reducing elements to minimize wear and improve efficiency.
• The shaft can be driven in a continuous 360° rotation or alternately in different directions for different tool-member lifting movements.
• The packaging machine may have work stations for forming, sealing, and separating or cutting, and at least two work stations can be arranged on different vertical levels for a more compact design.
• The frame supports the shaft and stabilizes the packaging machine to prevent vibrations and ensure precision in the packaging process.
• Tool members can be displaced in the production direction of the packaging machine for easy adaptation to varying conditions, and two transfer mechanisms may be provided for some work stations to prevent canting and ensure reliable operation.
• The text also mentions modifications such as providing further work stations, driving tool members with a linear movement, and using a lifting device for the feed system to prevent excessive heating of the packaging material.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a disposable finishing article with a permanently affixed drive member.
• The drive member includes a backing flange with gripping means and a retaining nut with a radial flange and protrusion for securing the flange and nut together.
• A pressure cap is held in place by the gripping means and extends to engage the power tool spindle seat.
• The assembly places the abrasive finishing article in compression during use, ensuring a secure attachment and preventing relative rotation.
• The assembly does not require adhesives for construction and can be easily assembled without tools.
• The assembly is relatively lightweight and vibration-free, with all parts perfectly aligned and parallel when in compression.
• The assembly can accommodate all standard diameter depressed center grinding wheels, including four inch, four and a half inch, five inch, seven inch, and nine inch.
• The assembly is less expensive than prior art throw-away articles while meeting all safety standards.
• The assembly provides a secure and efficient solution for mounting disposable finishing articles on rotatable spindles of power tools.

* The invention involves a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system with a housing block and a motor, where pressure fluid entrained by the piston pump is delivered to spring chambers, far from electrical components, for collection.
* This design eliminates the need for permeable elements at a central venting point or check valves, resulting in cost savings and a hermetic seal of the unit from the environment.
* The housing block can be produced economically with fewer conduits, and the design allows for the invasion of water between the container and the housing block to be averted, while also enabling the motor to be delivered complete to an assembly line without the risk of water invasion.

* The invention introduces a third dog in a power and free conveyor system, which is normally held out of operative position by the track but can be moved to operative position to transfer the carrier across short or long distances.
* The second and third dogs include cam projections that engage portions of the track, allowing selective transfer of the carrier by moving one or the other of the dogs to operative position.
* The system enables minimum time transfer with minimum cost and maintenance, accommodating various systems with varying transfer distances.

• The text describes a railroad car center plate assembly bowl liner made of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) with conductive material additive for effective grounding without additional grounding apparatus.
• The liner is designed to eliminate the need for lubrication and provide a self-lubricating, pliable, and non-stretchy material that is free from distending or stretching characteristics.
• The liner is conductive, made from UHMW-PE specially mixed with 2% carbon black, which increases conductivity as the liner wears and provides polishing and wear hardening.
• The liner is proportioned to fully fill the space between the truck bolster bowl and the body bolster center plate, limiting lost motion movement and providing vertical support.
• The liner is available in both bowl and flat disk configurations, with the flat disk version providing flat slip surfaces in a car with a partial metal liner.
• The liner meets both the coefficient of friction requirements of the all UHMW-PE liner and the electrical conductivity standards, making it an improvement over both the all UHMW-PE liner and the clip or shunt grounded version.

• The invention is a gate valve for controlling bulk dispensing of viscous substances, mounted on the spout of a bag or pouch.
• It includes a tubular sleeve with a dispensing passage and a curved gate carried by a guide.
• The gate is reciprocated by the fingers to position it over the discharge outlet, creating a seal when closed and no obstruction when open.
• The guide and gate are curved complementally transversely for effective sealing and variable flow.
• The valve assembly is removably mounted on the spout of a bag in a dispenser, with a tapered sleeve and annular sealing ribs for frictionally engaging the spout.
• The gate valve member comprises a plate with channel-formations that receive the guide plate, drawing it tightly into engagement.
• The gate is reciprocated on the guide by an integral extension with flat-finger and split lugs for vertical or radial movement.
• The valve can be easily disassembled for cleaning and reassembled by reversing the procedure.
• The valve functions in inclined position, allowing for one-handed operation and complete cut-off with an effective seal.

• The invention provides a vehicle rearview mirror system that can adapt to different protocols of a vehicle control output, enabling its use in various vehicles.
• The system includes a mirror control that receives the vehicle control output and determines its protocol through software processing, using a microcomputer and monitoring the output's voltage levels or other features. The mirror control adjusts the reflectance level of an electro-optic reflective element based on the determined protocol, and may also control a lighting assembly associated with the mirror assembly.

* The present invention introduces an anti-dive unit with a damped telescopic front suspension to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles, reducing chassis vibration during braking.
* The anti-dive unit, responsive to brake force applied to the front wheel, uses a hydraulic pump and modulator to control the oil flow and pressure, limiting the fork dive and increasing braking efficiency.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to movable partitions and bulkheads for separating or insulating cargo during transportation or storage in refrigerated trailers, railcars, or containers.
- Perishable cargo often requires temperature control, but maintaining the entire cargo space at the same temperature is unnecessary and costly when the cargo does not fill the entire space.
- Movable partitions and bulkheads have been used to divide cargo areas for multi-temperature transport, but they are typically fixed in place and cannot be moved independently.
- The present invention includes an improved partition system with at least two panels that can be moved independently using mounting assemblies.
- In a preferred embodiment, two bulkheads or panels are slidably attached to separate pairs of ceiling-mounted rails, allowing for the definition of multiple cargo areas with different temperatures.
- The panels are hingedly attached to trolley assemblies and slidably attached to the rails, permitting them to be moved in the fore and aft direction and raised to the ceiling when not in use.
- The panel, trolley assembly, and rail system can be implemented in various configurations, including side-mounted rails and panels that open like a door.
- The trolley assembly consists of hinge plates, hinge rods, and trolleys, which permit the panel to rotate and slide into a desired position.
- The panel is moved by lifting it up and to the rear of the trailer, securing it to the ceiling with a strap and hook, and then lowering it back down when needed.
- The panels can be used without center partition panels and can be secured to one another using various means, such as straps and buckles or channels and grooves.
</summary>

Note: The summary is approximately 38 sentences long, but I have tried to keep each bullet point as close to 4 sentences as possible while maintaining clarity and completeness.

• The text describes an invention of a sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography systems, specifically for use with liquid chromatographic columns and sanitary liquid handling systems in the pharmaceutical industry.
• Prior art rotary valves, such as those in U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,808,317, 2,985,589, 3,268,604, and 4,409,033, have been used for fluid distribution but lack sanitizable features.
• The invention includes a rotary carousel diaphragm valve with a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm integrally molded to form multiple sealing ports, allowing for periodic sanitization and cleaning without disassembly.
• The design includes a flexible wiping lip seal, port-sealing ledges and adjoining gutters, and a simple and reliable elastomeric means of ensuring sealing of all ports.
• The invention also includes an insert molding process for forming the rotary valve diaphragm seal in place, and the ability to remove and remotely store the rotor carousel in a sanitary sealed state, clean and store the stator in a sanitary sealed state, and permit sequential operation of different rotor carousels on the same stator actuator assembly.

* The text describes a patent application related to improved gas-liquid contacting trays and valve-tray assemblies.
* The invention includes an improved tray valve assembly for a process column, which comprises a plurality of apertures formed in the tray, a valve cover mounted thereon, and a circular tray valve supported by first and second legs.
* The first leg is wider than the second leg and intercepts the flow of liquid across the tray, while the legs are mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions for defining the orientation of the valve.
* The invention also includes a method of mixing vapor with liquid discharged from a downcomer onto an underlying cross-flow tray, which involves forming the tray with a plurality of directional thrust valves and biasing the frontal end of the disc for facilitating the directional flow of vapor through the valve.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
- It reduces variances in output pressure caused by large differences in input pressure and is inexpensive, lightweight, and portable.
- The assembly comprises a pressurized fluid source, high-pressure and low-pressure lines, a fluid regulator, and a vane motor for converting fluid pressure into mechanical power.
- The vane motor is a preferred type, but any suitable device for translating fluid pressure into mechanical motion can be used.
- The vane motor is coupled to a generator that converts mechanical power into electrical energy, which can be stored in a battery for later use.
- An alternative embodiment uses dual vane motors, with one producing electricity and the other mechanical work.
- Another embodiment is a self-contained underwater breathing apparatus that recovers energy from compressed air before it is regulated.
</summary>

The present invention is a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure. It reduces variances in output pressure caused by large differences in input pressure and is inexpensive, lightweight, and portable. The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source, high-pressure and low-pressure lines, a fluid regulator, and a vane motor for converting fluid pressure into mechanical power. The vane motor is a preferred type, but any suitable device for translating fluid pressure into mechanical motion can be used. The vane motor is coupled to a generator that converts mechanical power into electrical energy, which can be stored in a battery for later use. An alternative embodiment uses dual vane motors, with one producing electricity and the other mechanical work. Another embodiment is a self-contained underwater breathing apparatus that recovers energy from compressed air before it is regulated.

* The pallet system includes a pallet with raised parallel guide rails and a pallet cap that fits onto it, with trays loaded onto the pallet by sliding them along the guide rails.
* The system includes end plates that can be vertically positioned at the ends of the pallet to secure the load and restrict lateral and longitudinal movement of items.
* The end plates can be shaped to complement the contours of the trays and nest within each other to save space when not in use.
* The pallet system can be customized for various loads, including trays for fragile items like eggs, with features such as slanted guide rails, end stops, and end plates shaped to fit the tray edges.

* The text describes an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which uses magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels suspended in a saucer shell using magnetic forces.
* The text discusses the design of radial and axial magnetic suspension structures for the rotary-wing wheels, using permanent magnets, electromagnets, or superconducting materials.
* The text also describes the use of coaxial axial or radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems to improve the power performance and stability of the flying saucer by offsetting reactive torques.
* The electric engine of the flying saucer consists of the magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, electromotive ring, and magnetic suspension shaft, forming a magnetic suspension electric engine.

• The text describes an invention related to streptavidin muteins, which are modified forms of streptavidin with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands. These muteins are produced using recombinant DNA technology and are used for the isolation, purification, and determination of biological substances, particularly other recombinant proteins.
• The text explains that the conventional biotin/streptavidin system, which is widely used in molecular biology, has limitations, and there is a need to extend its range of application. The peptide ligand system, which uses streptavidin-binding peptides instead of biotin, is a successful approach to overcome these limitations.
• The invention optimizes the streptavidin/peptide ligand system by mutating specific amino acid positions in streptavidin to improve binding strength. The mutations are in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53, and the resulting muteins have a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands than wild-type streptavidin.

• The text describes a patent related to methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts.
• Guanylating agents react with amines or pyrrolidines in the presence of nickel catalysts to form substituted guanidines.
• Nickel catalysts preferably in the zero oxidation state, derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina, are used.
• Thioureas and isothioureas are preferred guanylating agents, with at least one R group being a protecting group, such as Boc, Cbz, or arylsulfonyl groups.
• The reactions are carried out at room temperature or under ambient conditions, with high yields and minimal reagents, making the methods advantageous for industrial drug production.
• The text provides examples of synthesizing N-substituted and N,N-disubstituted guanidines using bis-protected thioureas and N-arylsulfonyl-S-methylisothiourea in the presence of nickel catalysts.
• The reactions are believed to occur via a mechanism involving nickel(0) species coordinating with the divalent sulfur of thiourea and undergoing oxidative insertion into the carbon-sulfur double bond.
• The methods are advantageous as they minimize the use of toxic reagents and by-products, and the nickel catalysts are essentially completely recoverable after the reactions.
• The text includes examples of synthesizing various guanidines using different amines, solvents, and reaction conditions, with high yields and short reaction times.
• The methods are applicable to the synthesis of a wide range of guanidines, including those with aromatic and aliphatic amines, and can be carried out in various solvents, such as DMF, THF, DMSO, and water.

* The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for continuously electrolytically coloring aluminum strips or wires with high weatherability or fade resistance.
* A conventional method for continuously coloring aluminum articles involves degreasing, anodization, and immersion in a dye bath, but the resulting colors have poor weatherability.
* The invention uses an anodic oxidation bath and an electrolytic coloring bath, with the aluminum strip or wire functioning as an anode in the former and a cathode in the latter without direct connection to a power source.
* The anodic oxidation bath contains sulfuric acid and may include other additives, forming an oxide film thicker than 4 microns for effective coloring.
* The electrolytic coloring bath contains a specific acid or water-soluble metal salt and can produce various colors depending on the bath composition and electrolytic conditions.
* The current density and electrolysis time in the electrolytic coloring bath are controlled by the area of the aluminum strip or wire, the amount of electric current, and the period of immersion.
* The apparatus includes a means for continuously supplying an aluminum strip or wire, a means for passing it through the baths, and a means for controlling the electric circuit.
* The aluminum strip or wire is first degreased, etched, and introduced into the current supply bath, where it acts as a cathode and undergoes electrolytic degreasing.
* The aluminum strip or wire is then anodized in the anodic oxidation bath and electrolytically colored in the electrolytic coloring bath without the need for a large amount of electrical energy.
* The apparatus can be used for producing aluminum strips or wires with excellent weatherability or fade resistance for various industries.

* The present invention describes a process for producing transgenic plants or plant cells transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest, using two or more different vectors adapted for site-specific recombination and integration into the chromosome.
* The process allows for efficient assembly and optimization of the DNA sequence of interest in planta, enabling the study of gene functions and the creation of safer vectors.
* The choice of suitable promoters for driving recombinase expression is crucial for the success of the process, as it affects the efficiency of T-DNA region assembly and recovery of primary transformants.
* Different methods, such as Agrobacterium-mediated delivery or particle bombardment, can be used to provide plant cells or plants with the precursor vectors, depending on the plant species to be transformed.

* The present invention relates to a swash plate compressor with a fluorocarbon-coated aluminum swash plate for improved durability and low friction.
* Swash plate compressors have a rotating swash plate that reciprocates pistons, causing shear-type frictional contact between the swash plate and piston shoes, leading to wear and decreased efficiency.
* Prior art solutions include electroplated metal matrix coatings with fluororesin, but these require expensive materials and complex processes.
* The present invention uses a heat-curable, cross-linked coating of PTFE fluoroelastomer directly bonded to the aluminum swash plate, along with lubricious and load bearing additives.
* The coating is applied via aqueous spray and cured in an oven, allowing for simultaneous coating of both facial and end surfaces.
* The coating process does not require high-finish polishing or expensive base materials, and the roughened swash plate surface increases adhesion.
* The coating exhibits high durability and low coefficient of friction, increasing compressor efficiency and lifespan.
* The use of non-hypereutectic aluminum for the swash plate results in equal performance to hypereutectic aluminum and improved performance over tin-coated swash plates.
* The coating thickness can be controlled during application, and excess coating can be machined off if necessary.
* The invention offers several advantages over prior art solutions, including cost savings, simplified manufacturing process, and improved performance.

* The present invention provides novel polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings for semiconductor devices, specifically for use in photolithography processes using 193 nm (ArF) and 248 nm (KrF) light beams.
* The polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at specific wavelengths to prevent standing wave effects and light reflection, and to eliminate rear diffraction and reflected light from lower layers. They can be prepared using reaction equations involving polyhydroxystyrene resin, diazonaphthoquinone halide, and an amine in a solvent such as tetrahydrofuran. The resulting polymers form a cross-linked structure when hard-baked, allowing for the formation of a spectroscopically stable organic anti-reflective coating material. The polymers have proven effective in increasing product yield and preventing problems such as cutting or footing during pattern formation in the manufacture of 64M, 256M, 1G, 4G, and 16G DRAM semiconductor devices.

• The invention describes a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic, with good optical and mechanical properties and good orientability. It can be produced cost-effectively and passes fire tests to DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1, as well as the UL 94 test.
• The film comprises at least one white pigment, at least one UV absorber, and at least one flame retardant, with the UV absorber and flame retardant being fed directly as masterbatch during the production of the film. The film has excellent UV resistance, does not embrittle on exposure to heat, and is thermoformable.

• The present invention provides a novel process for manufacturing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) in an economical, industrially feasible manner using continuous gas phase hydrofluorination with heterogeneous catalysis.
• The organic feed is 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b), and the fluorinating agent is hydrofluoric acid (HF).
• The process achieves very high conversion and selectivity (both over 99%) for 143a, while avoiding the formation of olefinic byproducts.
• The catalyst used is a chromium salt, which may be unsupported or supported, and a cocatalyst such as nickel, cobalt, or manganese salts may be used.
• The process can be carried out at temperatures between 30° C. and 400° C., preferably between 100° and 250° C., and at pressures between 1 atmosphere and 200 psig.
• The HF/142b molar ratio in the feed is crucial to avoid olefin formation, and higher ratios are required at higher reaction temperatures.
• The process can be run adiabatically in a continuous, plug flow reactor, and the adiabatic process provides a method to recover 143a as product using only an acid removal system.

• The text describes an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having the formula: ##STR3## using hypophosphorous acid to increase product yield and reduce impurities.
• Pyrazolotriazoles, which are useful magenta couplers for photographic products, are difficult to synthesize and have limited synthetic routes.
• The most common method for desulfurization involves a two-step process: ring contraction and hydrolysis/desulfurization.
• However, this method generates unwanted impurities, including thione 8 and disulfide 9, which can interfere with subsequent reaction steps and are detrimental in photographic systems.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid in the desulfurization step reduces the formation of these impurities, resulting in a higher yield and purer product.
• The process is also advantageous because it forms H2S as a by-product, which is readily removed, and does not affect other functional groups in the molecule.
• The process can be used to prepare a 3,6-disubstituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole from a 3,6-disubstituted-7H-1,2,4triazolo[3,4-b][1,3,4]thiadiazine.
• The process involves reacting the thiadiazine with an acylating agent to form an acylated intermediate, which is then reacted with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and pyrazolotriazole.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid in the desulfurization step also reduces the formation of sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.
• The process is applicable to a wide range of substituents R and R′, as long as they meet the criteria of being stable, non-reactive, and not preventing the formation of the desired compound.
• The process can be conducted at various temperatures and pressures, and the reaction time depends on the reaction conditions and inherent reactivity of the reactants.

<summary>

- The text describes an invention for forming fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types using a method and apparatus that eliminates the disadvantages of previous methods.
- The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of each fiber lot before each pass and determining a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion.
- Only the calculated partial quantity is removed from the measured fiber lot during each pass, ensuring no residual fibers remain and a homogeneous mixture is obtained.
- The partial quantity is removed not later than a predetermined period to maintain a determined time schedule and ensure a consistent supply to after-connected processing machines.
- The apparatus includes a bale opener, quantity measuring device, and control device that determines the precise partial quantities and controls the fiber removing operation.
- The control device may include a timer, switch contacts, and limit switches to ensure accurate and efficient fiber removal.
</summary>

The text outlines an invention for creating fiber mixtures from various fiber types using a novel method and apparatus. The method measures the entire momentary quantity of each fiber lot before each pass and calculates a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion. During each pass, only the calculated partial quantity is removed from the measured fiber lot, eliminating residual fibers and ensuring a homogeneous mixture. The partial quantity is removed not later than a predetermined period to maintain a consistent supply to after-connected processing machines and prevent idle run. The apparatus includes a bale opener, quantity measuring device, and control device that determines the precise partial quantities and controls the fiber removing operation. The control device includes a timer, switch contacts, and limit switches to ensure accurate and efficient fiber removal.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns in at least two layers laid at an angle to the long axis of the fabric.
• Traditional knitted or woven fabrics cannot provide sufficient strength for structural uses, leading to the development of non-woven fabrics.
• The most desirable non-woven fabrics have at least two layers with yarns at approximately 45° to the long axis, lying at 90° to each other, but angles can vary.
• A rake mechanism, synchronized with but driven separately from the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, improves yarn parallelism and allows for overlapping of return courses.
• The rake mechanism accepts and retains yarns between or on needles, which are then placed onto or between conveyor needles using a movement opposed to the conveyor direction.
• The rake mechanism can move a full or fractional course width, determining the amount of overlap and fabric density, while the yarn carrying means can be slowed near the ends of travel to aid in parallelism.
</summary>

• The present invention provides a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom with varying weft carrying forces.
• This is achieved by ejecting air under different pressures or for different intervals of time from subnozzles or by using subnozzles with different orifice diameters.
• The weft carrying forces are adjusted to carry each weft thread through the warp shed at the same speed under stable conditions and prevent undue consumption of pressurized air.
• The invention applies to air jet looms with multiple weft threads and can be incorporated into looms with or without subnozzles, with pressurized air ejected simultaneously or sequentially from subnozzles.

* The present invention relates to a process for spinning bast fibres, including health preservation, opening, cleaning, carding, and spinning, to produce bast fibre yarn with low end breakage rate.
* The process involves health preserving bast fibre strips under specific temperature, humidity, and duration conditions to improve their flexibility and spinnability.
* The invention also covers a process for blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, which adopts the same health preservation technique to produce multi-fibre yarn with improved work efficiency and product quality.

• The present invention provides a method and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses using imbedded sensors in covered rolls.
• The invention utilizes multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to cancel rotational variability and obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile. The sensors are strategically placed to measure the pressure being placed against the web and to cancel rotational variability of 1 and 2 times the rotational frequency. The data obtained from the arrangement of sensors allows for the calculation and display of a rotational variability profile, providing real-time information for obtaining a more accurate nip pressure profile.

* The invention is an apparatus for an ironing board that supports an electrical cord and holds an article, such as a spray starch can or beverage container. It includes a clamp section for securing the apparatus to the ironing board, a flexible cord support for the electrical cord, and a removable article holder.
* The clamp is C-shaped with a pair of leg portions, one engaging the ironing surface and the other adjustable for securing the apparatus to the board. The cord support is pivotable and has a resilient spring section for supporting the cord above the ironing surface. The article holder has tangs that detachably attach to the clamp and can be removed when not in use.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for sewing machines that can effectively form buttonholes in various materials without failure or overlap.
- The device includes a foot pad, a travelling assembly with a slidable member, and an adjustable stop.
- The foot pad attaches to a presser bar, and the travelling assembly includes a work engaging shoe and plate, with rails for guiding the foot pad.
- The travelling assembly has an initial position defined by oppositely acting springs, and the slidable member can be positioned by a button for the buttonhole, carrying a tab to actuate the tripping lever.
- The adjustable stop engages the tripping lever to terminate buttonhole formation, allowing the operator to precisely define the closure point and prevent open or overlapping buttonholes.
- The sewing machine operates by causing top and bottom bar stitches and left and right leg zig-zag stitches to be formed in response to the tripping lever's position.
- The operator positions the button between V-notches, adjusts the screw to engage the tripping lever, and sews the buttonhole. Adjustments can be made for different materials to prevent slippage and ensure proper buttonhole formation.
</summary>

* The text describes an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, which includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
* The conveyor is an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined horizontal path.
* The liquid applicator is located at a first station along the path for applying the liquid to the web during motion, and the suction device is at a second station for removing the liquid by suction during motion.
* The dwell stretch is located between the applicator and the suction device and conducts the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.
* The longer contact time of the washing or rinsing liquid with the substances to be removed from the web leads to improved washing effect and less tension in the textile web.
* The apparatus is especially advantageous for printed materials, as effective washing is possible without soiling a white background or stacking the web.
* A preferred area of application is soilage washing, which can remove considerable amounts of soilage at relatively little expense.
* The dwell stretch can be formed by an air pass or a freely rotating drum, and the textile web is guided with little tension using drums and rollers.
* The suction device is disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt and causes the web to adhere to the belt and be entrained by it.
* The drum can be made of a sieve material or other designs, and the fabric treatment apparatus can have a compact construction.
* The textile web is guided back from the dwell loop to the sieve belt at a point downstream and closely adjacent to the point of exit from the belt.
* The apparatus can include multiple assembly units, each with a liquid applicator, dwell stretch, and suction device.
* The textile web passes through multiple dwell loops in each assembly unit, and catch plates are provided below the sieve belt for collecting liquid for recycled usage.
* The textile web is further processed after leaving the guide drum, which may include a fastness treatment.
* Another fabric treatment apparatus has a similar design but uses a sieve drum instead of an air pass for the dwell stretch.
* The textile web travels between guide rollers over a meander path corresponding

<summary>
• The text describes a dry cleaning machine with an air flow system to bring ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, while minimizing the exhausting of residual solvent vapors from the tubs.
• The machine includes a pair of nested tubs with a common access opening, a header chamber, a solvent distributing system, and an air distributing system.
• During the fill and wash portion of the cycle, the solvent is pumped from the storage tank through filters and into the tubs, while the airflow is controlled by valves to prevent exhausting solvent vapors.
• During the drain and spin portion of the cycle, the solvent is drained from the tubs and the solvent flow system is altered to provide two separate solvent flow paths, one for continuous filtration and the other for dumping the solvent already in the tubs.
• The tumble dry with heat portion of the cycle involves the continuous filtration of the solvent and the isolation of the solvent distributing system from the circulating drying air.
• The last minute of the cycle involves reversing the flow of the solvent through the filters in an operation known as "backwash."
• The air flow system includes a pair of airflow hoses and electrically energized oneway valves for controlling the flow through these hoses.
• During the fill and wash portion of the cycle, the airflow is controlled to prevent the user from encountering solvent vapor fumes while loading or unloading clothes.
• The machine also includes a solvent vapor handling system to keep the pressure within the machine within low enough limits and prevent leakage, and a refrigeration system to condense the vapors in the condenser box and maintain the liquid solvent in the storage tank at a predetermined temperature.
</summary>

• The present invention is a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly melt-spun nonwoven webs, using a quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width.
• The linear plane of filaments in the slot impingement point section has constant filament distribution, providing good control of cross-machine uniformity.
• The system uses the same air for quenching and drawing, eliminating the need for two sources of air and associated equipment.
• The drawing chamber is small and has no long nozzle sections, allowing for higher quench pressures without structural deflection problems.
• The small amount of close tolerance machined surface area exposed to the fiber stream collects less dirt, polymer drippings, and monomer build-up than other systems.
• The necessary drawing tension can be obtained by selecting a suitable slot gap opening, and filament cooling is controlled by regulating quench fluid temperature and air flow rate.
• The length of the quench chamber and spinneret capillaries can vary depending on the material and desired web properties.
• The method and apparatus are flexible and can accommodate a wide variety of materials and operating conditions.
• The invention harnesses the positive aspects of both eductive and non-eductive systems and solves many problems associated with conventional nonwoven spun bond systems.

<summary>
• The text describes various embodiments of a sewing machine that uses ultrasonic waves to detect the position of a marker or pen tip on a work cloth and set the sewing position accordingly.
• The first embodiment uses receivers on the sewing machine to detect the ultrasonic waves and calculates the specified coordinates based on the detection timings and the known positions of the receivers.
• The second embodiment uses receivers on an embroidery unit that can be attached and detached from the sewing machine, allowing for more flexibility in positioning the work cloth.
• The third embodiment uses an ultrasonic pen that outputs an electromagnetic wave signal instead of an electrical signal, which is detected by a detector inside the sewing machine.
• The fourth embodiment adds a receiver to the sewing machine and uses three receivers to detect the ultrasonic waves, allowing for more accurate positioning.
• The ultrasonic pen in all embodiments can be used to easily and accurately specify the position on the work cloth for sewing without the need for markers or other physical references.
• The receivers are positioned to ensure they can accurately detect the ultrasonic waves while minimizing interference from the user or other objects.
• The electrical configuration of the sewing machine and the ultrasonic pen are designed to efficiently transmit and receive the necessary signals for position detection.
• The processing performed by the CPU of the sewing machine involves identifying the transmission and detection timings and calculating the specified coordinates based on the known positions of the receivers and the Pythagorean theorem.
• The various embodiments satisfy certain conditions to ensure accurate position detection, such as the receivers being separated from each other, located above the work cloth, and not being obstructed by the user or other objects.
</summary>

• Third embodiment: electromagnetic wave signal from pen detected by sewing machine detector.

• The present invention relates to methods and preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials, specifically cotton, linen, or other natural fibers, by adding functional additives.
• Known textile articles with functional additives for enhancing properties like UV protection and anti-bacterial properties rapidly lose their effectiveness after several washing cycles.
• The invention uses ultrafine wool particles or powder as carriers for functional additives due to their exceptional carrying and retention ability, which enhances the durability of functional enhancements.
• Wool fibers have a unique structure with helical proteins and a waxy coating, making them ideal for carrying and retaining functional additives.
• The preparation process involves pulverizing wool into ultrafine powder, forming a suspension, and adding functional additives before applying it to the fabric using methods like printing, padding, or foam application.

• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine for specialized quilting of patterns using a separate process controller for table movement and a separate computer for sewing machine functions.
• The machine includes a frame quilting table that can move in the X and Y directions, allowing precise pattern programming through a computer aided design feature and machine readable language.
• The sewing machine function and table movement can be separately changed by reprogramming the respective computers, reducing the effort involved in reprogramming the entire system.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image using hydroentanglement and a support layer or scrim.
* The fabric is formed from a first and second precursor web, each with a fibrous matrix, which are juxtaposed and hydroentangled on a three-dimensional image transfer device.
* The support layer or scrim acts as a fiber distribution control layer, preventing excessive intermingling of the fibrous constituents of the two outer layers.
* The fabric can be made using various fibers, including staple length fibers, continuous filaments, or blends, and can be hydroentangled on a foraminous surface before or after imaging.
* The fabric can have apertures and can be used in various applications, such as home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and industrial products.
* The present invention provides a durable, three-dimensional image on the fabric, which is useful for applications where a pronounced image is required, while maintaining the necessary mechanical characteristics.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
- The device includes a stop that is displaceable out of the feed path and connectable to the sewing machine for controlling the operation.
- The stop is carried by a doubled arm lever member that is part of a control means including a control switch and a setting means for adjusting the position of the stop.
- The stop is mounted for being displaced by a setting means in the form of an air cylinder and substantially perpendicularly to the feed motion of the workpiece.
- The limits of the setting motion of the stop can be adjusted by displaceable stops.
- The device ensures a continuous operation, making it possible to sew relatively stiff strips of material, and being insensitive to disturbances.
- The sewing machine control for feeding strip materials to a workpiece is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.
</summary>

Explanation:

The text describes an invention for a device that feeds and sews a strip of material onto a cut of fabric using a sewing machine. The device includes a stop that is displaceable out of the feed path and connectable to the sewing machine for controlling the operation. The stop is carried by a doubled arm lever member that is part of a control means including a control switch and a setting means for adjusting the position of the stop. The stop is mounted for being displaced by a setting means in the form of an air cylinder and substantially perpendicularly to the feed motion of the workpiece. The limits of the setting motion of the stop can be adjusted by displaceable stops. The invention ensures a continuous operation, making it possible to sew relatively stiff strips of material, and being insensitive to disturbances. The sewing machine control for feeding strip materials to a workpiece is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.

<summary>

* The invention relates to a connective knitting method for joining two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine.
* Two tape-shaped knit pieces are knitted with a boundary between them on a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
* When both pieces reach a specified length, the loop portion of the moving side knit fabric is transferred to the fixed side knit fabric and overlaid, forming a new loop.
* This process decreases one loop in the moving side fabric and two loops in total.
* The new loop and a part of the loop of the adjoining moving side fabric are overlaid and a new loop is formed, decreasing one more loop in the moving side fabric.
* By repeating this process, the end parts of both knit fabrics are joined and the final end portion is prevented from loosening.
* The knitting machine used is a flat knitting machine with multiple knitting needles on needle beds that can move and slide back and forth.
* The method can be used to join tape-shaped knit pieces in the collar part of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, or neck rope portion of an apron.
* The two pieces of knit fabric are knitted together and the transfers are carried out by a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.
* The invention can improve productivity and reduce manufacturing cost compared to sewing methods for joining tape-shaped knit pieces.
</summary>
