* The invention relates to a flexible traction element with stranded cables sheathed in a thermoplastic plastics material for passenger and goods lifts.
* The production line includes a reel for unwinding stranded cables, a device for their precise orientation, a heater for preheating, an extruder for co-extrusion, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller.
* The stranded cables are cleaned, oriented, and preheated before being sheathed in the extruder, ensuring precise positioning and adhesion to the jacket.
* The traction elements have a roughened surface and can be wound into band rolls for increased friction and dimensional stability.
* The method involves degreasing and preheating the stranded cables, followed by co-extrusion with the plastics material, resulting in improved adhesion and long-term durability.

* The invention provides a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine with holding means that hinder the guiding of the needle thread loop and pull-back as little as possible.
* The holding means are arranged on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand unhindered and be pulled back without impediment.
* The slight impediment caused by the bending of the spring rod can be eliminated completely by a capsule release device that gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse, creating a gap for the needle thread loop to pass through unhindered.
* The invention includes a rotary hook with first and second cams on respective sides of a projection of the bobbin housing, a spring rod extending between the cams, and a capsule release device with a finger and cam for controlling the rotation of the bobbin housing.

* The text describes a method for producing silicon-based nanowires using electrospinning and four-component inks consisting of a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent.
* The process involves forming a viscous solution, expelling it through a high electric field to form fibers, and transforming the fibers into silicon-containing materials through thermal or laser processing.
* The resulting silicon-containing fibers can be used as components of other composite materials, such as anodes for lithium-ion batteries, by coating them with a conductive material and mixing with a binder.

* The present invention provides an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each having a controller with a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension responsive braking element.
* Each controller has a tensioning lever with a roller that engages threads and a biasing arrangement activated by fluid pressure, which influences the tensioning lever and alters thread tension.
* The biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, allowing for central control of thread tension for the entire creel.
* When the warping machine is shut off, the braking force throughout the creel can be increased for rapid braking.
* The biasing arrangement is preferably a piston/cylinder assembly, which can follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever and prevent contamination of threads.
* The tensioning lever preferably subtends an angle greater than 45° to the horizontal plane, and the working elevation angle of the biasing arrangement attached to the tensioning lever should be less than 45° for equal force component on the tensioning lever.

• The present invention provides a sewing machine detector with a thinner and more compact detecting section, which is durable despite the detrimental effects of vibration. It achieves this by using flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs that detect sewing machine speed, needle UP position, needle DOWN position, and thread trimmer timing position. These discs are made of light-transmitting synthetic resin and are mounted coaxially on a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft. They are free to rotate and are clamped in place when set to the proper angles.
• The optical fiber supporter includes two identical pieces, each with linear optical fiber fixing holes for locking the ends of the light sending and receiving optical fibers. The fibers are not flexed when inserted in the fiber fixing holes, and second reflecting portions are provided opposite the end faces of the fibers. The first and second reflecting portions are in opposition, and light transmitted from the light sending optical fibers is reflected by the first reflecting portions, passes through the light shielding discs, and is reflected by the second reflecting portions to enter the light receiving optical fibers.
• The present invention eliminates the need for curved reflective discs, reducing manufacturing costs and resulting in a thinner, more compact detecting section. It also reduces stress imposed on the optical fibers by supporting them linearly and enabling optional and additional optical axes to be generated. The invention also includes an optical fiber power indicating cable that does not interfere with sewing machine control circuitry and can be run simultaneously with the optical fibers for detection, simplifying construction.

* The present invention simplifies the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness by combining critical operations such as completion of coagulation, washing with non-alkaline water, and drying.
* The completion of coagulation can be achieved through various methods, including passing time, acid treatment, or a combination of both, while maintaining a coagulation index between 15 and 25.
* The washing process reduces the amounts of sulphur, iron, zinc, and lead on the yarn to specified levels, resulting in a finished yarn with a degree of white not lower than 45. The process is economical and can be carried out at spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min.

<summary>

- The inventors developed a small, cost-effective deaeration tank for removing oxygen from pulp before washing, which can operate at atmospheric or low pressure/vacuum.
- The tank is designed to be the same diameter as an oxygen reactor and placed on top of it, with no moving parts and a closed design for steam or oxygen recovery.
- The deaeration tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe. The swirl inducing fluid is filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach.
- The tank is cylindrical with an open top and flat bottom, having a diameter "D" and a height of approximately 2"D". Its height depends on the consistency of the pulp slurry.
- The inlet pipe is located a distance of 10-50% of the tank height from the top, allowing the pulp to enter above the surface and splash against the side wall.
- The outlet is located in the bottom plate, sized to handle the amount of pulp leaving the tank, and has a flange that attaches to a flange on the washer line. The oxygen-filled slurry enters the tank through the inlet pipe and splashes against the side wall, while the height of the slurry is controlled by a height sensor at the bottom. The body of the slurry is swirled by filtrate from the washer, entering the tank through a filtrate swirler inlet located from the bottom a distance of 10-25% of the tank height. The emergency bypass line also has its center line between the bottom and the upper surface of the slurry and is in vertical alignment with the inlet pipe.
</summary>

• The text describes a new composite material concept called BTR (biomimetic tendon-reinforced) composites, obtained through a topology optimization process that maximizes out-plane stiffness. The fibers are evenly distributed in the matrix material, and the composite includes tendons, ribs, joints, flesh, skins, and shell.
• The BTR composite structure can be extended to three dimensions and various shapes, including flat, curved, and complex panels. The use of embedded fiber tendons allows for improved safety and out-of-plane performance.

• The present invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames that can plastically deform during a dynamic event to dissipate energy and preserve the structure from extensive damage.
• The device is easily removable and replaceable with another non-plastically deformed load-limiting device after plastic deformation.
• The invention includes a braced frame structure, a load-limiting device attached to a brace, and a connection means to connect the load-limiting device and the brace, allowing for biaxial support and energy dissipation in the braced frame structure.

* The present invention provides a bedroom cabinet with flat external surfaces and internal shelves and boxes that do not project from the outer periphery, allowing for effective utilization of space and a uniform air flow passage for natural ventilation.
* The bedroom cabinet consists of an outer casing and an inner casing with a clearance formed between them, which houses wirings, boxes for electric devices, and shelves for user belongings, while also increasing sound-proofing and providing a venting groove in spacer members interposed in the clearance.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a portable guard rail support for use in constructing temporary safety barriers at construction sites.
• Modern construction techniques require safety barriers with personal safety and retaining kick boards for uncompleted floors.
• Traditional methods use lumber, but they are time-consuming, labor-intensive, and not always reusable or rigid enough for safety inspectors.
• The invention provides a portable guard rail support with a flat bottomed base plate, upright column, guard rail support brackets, kick board retaining flange, angular brace, and safety tie-off ring.
• The guard rail support can be used with a concrete-filled steel base for anchoring to floors or ground surfaces.
• The guard rail support can be used to construct a safety barrier with overlapping wooden rails and kick boards or with short stubs of the same stock lumber.
• The safety tie-off ring can serve as a retaining and attachment means for safety cables or as a fastener for weatherproof tarpaulins.
• The guard rail support can be used to construct a mesh-like fence structure for additional safety.
• The guard rail support is dimensioned to accommodate 2"×4" wooden rails and meets safety regulations for top and intermediate rails and kick boards.
• The guard rail support is easy to install, disassemble, and reassemble, reducing liability and ensuring durability for repeated use.
</summary>

* The present invention is a pulsed power device and method for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) using pulsed power to generate high-frequency acoustic vibrations in geologic materials, extending the effective range of acoustic stimulation beyond the current limitation of about 1000 feet.
* The invention uses pulsed power to generate both direct acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations, which travel at different speeds and stimulate oil production at various scales in the reservoir. The method can be applied using a multi-level discharge device or multiple pulse sources in multiple wells to achieve continuous stimulation and extend the effective range of the technique.

* The text describes an exemplary splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures.
* The splice couples a soil reinforcing element to a grid-strip, creating a composite soil reinforcing element, and includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to seat transverse wires from both elements.
* The splice is secured by extending a connective device through perforations in the wave plates and tightening a nut to clamp down on the longitudinal wires, preventing longitudinal escape of the transverse wires and lateral translation of the elements.

* The present invention introduces a plow blade design with a fluid passageway and points of fluid ejection, produced using basic manufacturing processes for efficient production.
* The blade consists of a blade, leading edge sections, point, and a fluid tube. The fluid tube transfers pressurized fluid from the top of the plow into the blade, and the location and length of stitch welds define the fluid exit points and volume. The fluid pressure and length of the tube can be adjusted to optimize fluid ejection in high friction areas. The number of leading edge sections and stitch welds can also be varied to match specific job requirements.

<summary>
• The present invention is a building system that allows for larger stucco panels without movement control joints, exceeding the current height and width limitations in New Zealand.
• The system includes a frame or substructure with studs, battens, inner and outer meshes, and a plaster matrix that penetrates both meshes and covers the second mesh.
• The panels are reinforced with regional reinforcement, such as metallic or non-metallic mesh, and lattice-like periphery defining members at panel boundaries.
• The studs are of minimum cross-section of 45 mm×90 mm, and battens are of nominal 35 mm×40 mm cross-section.
• The first mesh is a metal mesh, and the second mesh is non-metallic, such as fibreglass.
• The outer corner skeletal or lattice member is batten-supported and over the inner mesh, and window and door openings have head and side jamb flashings.
• The plaster matrix is applied as more than one layer, and the rules mandate mesh sizes and reinforcement for some spaces between openings or elsewhere.
• The invention also includes methods for in situ formation of a reinforced plaster panel as cladding of a support structure, and a building structure comprising a pair of intersecting walls with battens, lower and higher sets of panels, and plural flashing members.
</summary>

* The invention provides a new and improved safe and door structure with a rectangular valuables receiving chamber and a door having a plateshaped separate steel door with inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for placement on the chamber, and a set of grooves on the opposite walls for retaining the door. The door is laterally displaced until it is in abutment with the seat of the shallower groove, and a lock assembly on the reverse side of the door prevents lateral movement and transmits force to the lock mechanism.
* The safe structure is readily assembled and has a low cost due to the use of integrally formed laterally extending grooves in the walls for receiving bar members, which are coupled together and retain the door in spaced relation after assembly. The bar members are formed of steel and have a length greater than the width of the corresponding walls, enabling the door to be received and removed from the chamber. The lockbolt engages a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement and reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt prevent transmission of force to the lock mechanism in case of intrusion attempts.

<summary>
• The text describes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that more accurately measure formation pressures at desired depths.
• The inlet to the pressure sensing apparatus is located at a desired depth in the formation and isolated to pressures produced by the formation at such depth.
• The first embodiment involves drilling a borehole, installing a grout pipe and pressure sensor arrangement, and pumping cement grout to create a communication path between the formation and the pressure transducer.
• The second embodiment uses a larger tube connected to a smaller fluid injection tube, which is pumped with fluid to displace cement grout and create a fluid pathway between the filter and the formation.
• The cement grout confines the inlet to the pressure sensor arrangement to the formation pressures that exist at the desired elevation, isolating the pressure transducer from borehole fluid pressures above or below the filter.
• The pressure transducer measures the formation pressure by sensing the pressure difference between the top and bottom of its sensing member, which is held at a static pressure.
</summary>

• The text discusses the importance of measuring formation pressures for engineering and environmental applications in various industries.
• Traditional piezometers, such as standpipe systems, have limitations, including volumetric problems and the need for good connections to the formation.
• To overcome these limitations, low volume pressure transducers were developed, including pneumatic and electrical types, and methods for cementing transducers directly into boreholes.
• The invention described in the text addresses the need for a more reliable connection system between a pressure sensing location and the transducer system, using a conduit and filter system to isolate the transducer from formation pressures at other levels in the borehole.
• The method involves cementing a conduit with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole, pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout, and then introducing fluid to displace the grout and create a fluid connection to the formation.
• The invention also includes methods for monitoring fluid pressure in subterranean formations using a conduit, a non-return valve, and cementitious material to create a fluid connection to the formation.

* The present invention provides a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which prevents tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations, ensures high slip resistance to tires, and is easy to maintain.
* The structure includes more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends, more than one elastic member mounted inside each step, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
* The joint block blocks up the expansion gap while permitting expansion function, allowing for smooth and safe vehicle traveling.
* The elastic members are made of laminated rubber and are easily joined together and subjected to deformation.
* The use of a joint block made of the same concrete as the traveling path provides increased slip resistance to tires.
* The components are detachably fitted together, allowing for easy maintenance.

* The present invention relates to a floor track system for transporting wheeled trucks into and out of a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment.
* One embodiment includes a wheel channel with a cover plate and hinge, preventing showered fluid from entering and contaminating the track system.
* Another embodiment utilizes inflatable elastomer seals that enclose the interior wheel channel of the track, sealing around hand truck wheel struts and preventing brine solution entry.
* The enclosed floor track system enhances brine solution recovery and reuse by segregating hand truck wheel structures from the fluid treatment chamber.
* The system is well adapted for use with horizontally axled hand trucks and those with depending I-beam struts.
* The inflatable seals act as a brake when inflated, preventing hand truck movement along the track system.
* The enclosed wheel channels and inflatable seal brackets are preferably constructed of stainless steel for resistance to corrosive attack.
* The present invention prevents brine solution contamination by hand truck wheels, enabling recirculation and reuse without decontamination.
* The enclosed floor track system also prevents corrosion of hand truck wheel bearings and deterioration of rubber wheels.
* Numerous changes can be made to the details and construction of the enclosed floor track system while staying within the scope of the invention.
* The invention provides a versatile and sanitary solution for transporting meat products into and out of fluid treatment chambers.
* The use of an enclosed floor track system fulfills the need for preventing brine solution contamination and enabling its recirculation and reuse.

* The present invention relates to a lock device for preventing a work machine's boom from being tilted by its own weight during operation.
* The lock device includes an engaging member on the boom and an engaged member on the boom bracket, with a hook part and a slot on the engaging member and a support pin and a guide member on the engaged member.
* The engaging member can slide along the slot and touch the guide member with either its first or second surface, allowing for easy manual locking and unlocking.
* The guide member is provided on the boom and does not become horizontal while the boom is rotated, ensuring the engaging member maintains the lock position at any rotation position.

• The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable suction head.
• The invention enables real-time regulation of suction during pool cleaning without adjusting the suction source.
• The adjustment mechanisms are located on the top of the vacuum head and can be operated by hand.
• The suction exerted by the vacuum head is precisely regulated without requiring suction source adjustment.
• The adjustment mechanisms can be added to certain types of existing pool cleaning devices without major retrofit.
• The adjustment mechanism is simple, easy to use, and can be manufactured inexpensively.
• The apparatus includes a rectangular platform with a central, cylindrical member, outboard and inboard roller assemblies, and a frame member.
• The inboard roller assemblies have axles that can be adjusted to change the spacing between the central, suction portion of the platform and the pool bottom.
• The adjustment mechanism uses a connector, elongated shank, wing nut, and coil spring to adjust the axle position and change the platform height.
• The roller height adjustment device can be added to certain types of existing suction head assemblies with minimum modification.

* The present invention provides a wear bushing retriever apparatus that can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieving the drill bit from the hole.
* The apparatus includes a retriever section with protruding members that engage an extended J-slot of a wear bushing, allowing vertical movement of the retrieving unit yet rotational movement during operation.
* The retriever unit is mounted onto a mandrel and connected to drill pipe, allowing a vertical play to prevent damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing.
* The apparatus is easily removable and installable for quickly removing the wear bushing during the drilling operation.

• The invention describes a vibratory tool for downhole use with a central passage for wireline or other tool access.
• The tool features an annular dump valve and a removable plug to activate vibration mode, preventing the valve from being slammed against a seat.
• The mandrel is powered by stacked pistons in the tool body, increasing power delivery and improving reliability.
• The tool can be operated with or without impacts, depending on the amount of surface overpull and the design of the valve and spring.
• The modular design allows for customization to specific work string requirements and eliminates significant cyclical impacts on the valve.

Additionally, the invention includes various embodiments using H-piles, barriers on the face or rear side, and textured bases for added stability.

• The text describes a problem with conventional composed stave floors or engineering floors, which include a thin sight substrate that warms up and deforms during sanding or maintenance, affecting their physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.
• An example embodiment proposes a solution by providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, which are assembled together using glue and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means.
• The use of multidirectional holding means prevents displacement or changes in dimensions, allowing for longer floor life and the ability to provide corrective maintenance. Additionally, the floors can be supplied pre-varnished with a harder glaze for improved resistance and appearance.

* The present invention introduces a ladder attachment with large contact area braces to increase stability and prevent damage to work surfaces.

* The design allows the ladder to straddle corners by pivoting the resilient pad horizontally, increasing accessibility to work surfaces.

* The present invention relates to a position sensor system that reduces wiring requirements and energy usage by multiplexing multiple sensors using a conditioned sensing signal and error correction signal.
* A position sensor includes a waveform generator that receives an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer and modifies it based on an error correction signal.
* An error correction generator provides the error correction signal using a comparator, controller, and signal processor.
* The error correction generator determines and eliminates static and error signals that do not deliver position information, saving energy.
* A window reference circuit constantly compares the ideal sensor output to the existing sensor output and adjusts it if necessary.
* The signal processor generates a reference signal that eliminates small values of drift and allows for rapid recalibration.
* The error correction generator generates a large reference signal that exceeds the largest voltage encountered by the sensor during maximum movement.
* The DAC and counter combination in the signal processor contains enough resolution to prevent error correction signals from being a significant portion of the conditioned sensing signal.
* The sensor system draws a minimum current upon power-up and initial calibration, and the sensor can be recalibrated at any time.
* The sensor generates a relatively small reference signal for eliminating small values of drift and a large reference signal for rapid recalibration due to sudden changes in offset voltage.
</summary>

- The present invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, eliminating the need for springs and offering infinitely variable valve displacement.
- The system uses a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, converting linear motion into variable reciprocating motion for valve control.
- The rotary cam has a grooved track that displaces a translating means, which reciprocates in a slot to achieve the first reciprocating linear movement.
- Attached to the slide is an assembly containing a rotating link, which rotates to control the valve's up and down movement based on the angle the slot makes with the line of action.
- A repeatable fixed point in the slot is required to define the closed position of the valve, regardless of the angle, and a slide can be adjusted to maintain this point.
- The cam groove curvatures are designed to provide proper rise and fall along with dwell time in concert with the engine.
- Computer control allows operation of any set of pistons and valves, optimizing fuel consumption and engine performance based on driving conditions.
- The invention is applicable to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, with a single cam controlling multiple valves through multi-fingered drive links and associated actuating mechanisms.
</summary>

• The lighting control region includes switches for independent control of each channel, and modules with LEDs that can be added or removed, each with electrical connectors that only connect to their respective channels.
• The modules have a thickness of less than 1 inch and are square in shape, with dimensions of approximately 3.75 inches in width and height.
• The system can include multiple lighting control regions, each with its own set of control channels and neutral channel, and can be controlled by dimmer switches for blue light and an on/off switch for white light.
• Some modules include radio frequency (RF) or other communication hardware for remote control, and the system can be controlled with in-line timers for setting on/off times and dimming effects.
• The lighting system can be used with various other structures, including underneath office or kitchen cabinets, and can be mounted to a bracket for easy installation and control.

* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for thermal machines, specifically for high-temperature fluid-flow machines, which avoids the disadvantages of prior art apparatuses, such as cast separating walls and thermal stresses.
* The invention achieves this by constructing the separating walls as separate inserts that are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured, rather than casting them together. This results in simplified production, flexibility, and efficient cooling.
* One embodiment of the invention is a hollow casting with integrally formed holders for the separating walls, which simplifies assembly and attachment and ensures a secure seal. The separating walls are flat strips made of metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic materials.
* Another embodiment connects the inserted separating walls by an integral material joint, such as soldering or welding, to the flow deflection apparatus for added security. The separating walls may be straight or bent into a U-shape to deflect cooling fluid, and can be secured on one or both sides.

• The present invention provides a system for controlling the fuel delivery system of a vehicle, allowing for both automatic and manual control of the throttle valve.
• During manual control, the vehicle driver has full control of the vehicle, preventing lurching or stalling when shifting from automatic to manual.
• The system can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission, automatically switching to the optimum control mode for the throttle based on transmission ratio.

• The invention describes a waste fuel burner that forms a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through it, drying and gasifying the fuel. Swirl air is introduced tangentially to the primary combustion chamber to maintain a steady temperature and separate particulate from the gas stream.
• The volatile gases are then partially oxidized in a first combustion chamber and completely burned in a second chamber with secondary combustion air. The flame holder in the secondary chamber prevents particulate matter from entering and forces it back into the primary chamber.
• The burner is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in load. It can effectively burn wet wood of 70% moisture content and produces a residue that is free of clinkers, assuming the ash fusing temperature is not lower than 1700° F. The burner can be added to any source of dirty, particulate-laden combustible gas to provide useful heat and meet environmental emission standards.

* The present invention is an efficient evaporative refrigeration system that keeps evaporating water separate from the cooling air stream using a heat exchanger, achieving sensible cooling.
* The system uses a major portion of the working air from the room to be cooled and a major portion of fresh air for the dry side of the heat exchanger, resulting in a larger temperature differential and maximum cooling.
* A hybrid system is also provided, which incorporates a vapor compression refrigeration unit to further cool a minor portion of the useful air, resulting in dehumidification and an additional reduction in dry bulb temperature.
* The system's efficiency is increased by using a composite heat exchanger design, where the condenser coil is disposed in the discharge path of the wet side of the heat exchanger, reducing energy required for condensation and overall power consumption.

* The text describes a fluid pump with two or more pump heads arranged in series, allowing fluid to flow from a reservoir into one pump head and then to the next in the series, eventually being discharged from an outlet in a final pump head.
* Each pump head comprises a housing containing an impeller, a drive shaft, and an inlet through which fluid is drawn. Fluid is moved by the impeller from the housing into at least two fluid conduits, which combine into one fluid flow before exiting the pump head.
* The drive structure, which may be powered by a single motor, is configured to commonly drive the impellers in each pump head. Drive shafts may be connected through one or more connectors to allow for transmission of rotational motion between shafts.
* The pump may be mounted on various support structures, such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer, to enable operation at a fluid reservoir.
* The design of the pump heads allows for common driving of the impellers while permitting fluid flow between them, making it impossible to construct by simply stacking known pumps together.

• The present invention provides an engine with a modular engine compression release brake system that includes engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders, reducing excess components and improving overall engine robustness.
• Each engine compression release brake is hydraulically actuated and operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve. When activated, the engine compression release brake opens the exhaust valve during the compression stroke, allowing compressed air to be vented and reducing engine braking horsepower requirements.

<summary>
• The text describes an invention related to support structures, specifically a link assembly between an engine and a gearbox.
• The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain them, allowing translation and forming a radial interface for dampening motion.
• The radial interface provides coulomb damping, reducing energy from translation and preventing gearbox detachment from the engine.
• The pin can shear under extreme loads, releasing the links to limit damage to the gearbox and prevent detachment.
• The female and male links are in contact at the radial interface, providing coulomb damping and preventing mounting link separation after pin shear.
• The use of the pin and radial interface obviates the need for all linkages and connections to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and complexity.
• The pin can be replaced during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break it.
• The terminology is not limiting, and modifications, variations, and alterations are possible without departing from the scope and spirit of the invention.
</summary>

Here's a more detailed summary:

<summary>
• The text discusses an invention related to support structures, specifically a link assembly for connecting an engine to a gearbox.
• The link assembly consists of a male link, a female link, and a pin. The female link receives the male link, allowing translation and forming a radial interface for dampening motion.
• The radial interface provides coulomb damping, which dissipates energy from the translation and prevents the gearbox from detaching from the engine.
• The pin selectively prevents the relative translation of the female and male links and can serve as a fusible link, shearing under extreme loads.
• The female and male links are in contact at the radial interface, which provides coulomb damping and limits the relative travel of the male link within the female link.
• The use of the pin and radial interface obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and complexity.
• The pin can be replaced during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break it.
• The terminology used in the text is not limiting, and modifications, variations, and alterations are possible without departing from the scope and spirit of the invention.
</summary>

• The present invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for military training, which utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic and an electrical ignition system.
• The invention produces realistic small arms fire noise and flash by electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides automatic and semiautomatic fire, interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt, and ensures safety by preventing firing when the weapon bolt is open.
• The expendable contains a plurality of rounds and can be installed in a firing unit that is inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
• The invention is cost-effective, reliable, low maintenance, and safe, as it does not require dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a cost-effective alternative to using blanks and a blank fire adapter for military training, which are expensive and produce sound levels below that of live round fire.
• The electrical control circuit consists of ten functional blocks, including a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, oscillators, a firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, firing sensors, and a MILES interface.
• The bolt interface provides a realistic simulation of operator actions during firing and ensures safety by preventing firing when the weapon bolt is open.
• The trigger interface detects the trigger pull and sends a signal to the oscillator control, which in turn enables the 500 Hertz oscillator to produce the sound of gunfire.
• The firing control utilizes thirty-one SCRs and sixty-two gate resistors to control the ignition of pyrotechnic charges, and the firing sensor detects the firing of each charge and sends a signal to the oscillator control to stop the drive to the firing control.
</summary>

• The disclosed concepts provide an efficient, clean burning burner and a system for removably attaching various heat utilizing appliances, including cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer.
• The burner features a combustion chamber with an outer wall, an inner shroud, and a fuel holder with perforations for air induction. Air flows through the fuel holder for initial combustion and around it for secondary and tertiary combustion, improving efficiency and reducing emissions.
• The burner includes a pivotally coupled ash pan, a cover, and manual couplings for attaching modular heat utilizing appliances. The ash pan has a water supply and a damper for controlling air flow, while the cover prevents inadvertent access to the combustion chamber and suppresses ember escape.

* The text describes a problem with in-line spark plug arrangements in rotary engines, where vapor films collect and disrupt cooling flow, leading to high thermal conditions and detrimental effects on the engine housing.
* The invention proposes a staggered spark plug arrangement, where the bosses are offset but symmetrically oppositely oriented about a centerplane, promoting close in-line arrangement of the spark plug terminals and improving coolant performance around the bosses.
* The invention also includes a predetermined offset from the line extending between the spark plug terminals, limited flow diverters or controllers between the bosses, and bosses with cylindrical trunks and terminals spaced apart a longitudinal distance less than 12 diameters of each boss. These features ensure controlled flow regime between the bosses and increase the heat transfer coefficient of the cooling circuit at the spark plug boss zone by at least 20%.

* The present invention is a method of minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during turbine control valve operational safety testing by using control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance.
* The method maintains the total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves constant, which in turn keeps the steam generator pressure constant and the inlet pressure regulator unaffected.
* The flow difference between the system with N valves and the system with N-1 valves is determined during design, and the difference is applied to the total flow demand to each of the N-1 valves based on the total N valve demand derived from the position of the valve under test.
* The use of the control valve test compensating control system of the present invention reduces pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure by 95% compared to not using flow compensation.

* The invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets A and B and one outlet, allowing a solution ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
* Pressurized cleaning apparatuses are known, including those using valves to mix fluids. In the commercial airline industry, a stand-alone cleaning apparatus is desired for multiple users with adjustable cleaning solution strength.
* The mixing valve includes a valve body, two inlet passages, an outlet passage, and a valve means for directing the two fluids toward the outlet. The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range between 0% and 100% of each fluid.
* Valve body 10 defines a bore with first and second inlets, a flow restricting device for reducing the flow rate of soap solution, and a second inlet for water. The outlet passage is open to bore 12 via a passage perpendicular to it and directly opposite a third passage.
* Valve member 52 includes a cylindrical portion, a sealing sleeve, a cylindrical portion for receiving a seal carrier, and a series of consecutive cylindrical spools. The valve member is stretched onto the cylindrical portion and compressed against the walls of the bore when the valve is disposed therein.
* Set screw 110 is provided for restraining translational motion of the valve after it is received within the bore. The valve defines a bore perpendicular to its longitudinal axis, sized identically to the bore in the valve member, and radially offset from it.
* The operation of the valve system involves rotating the handle to change the position of the valve, resulting in varying proportions of soap solution and water emerging from the outlet. The mixture can range from 100% water and 0% soap solution to 100% soap solution and 0% water.
* The valve system allows multiple identical valves to be operated from a common soap solution source and common water source without adversely affecting fluid pressure, due to flow reducing devices and the maximum flow rate occurring only when the bore is axially aligned with its respective passages.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing and cooling gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.
• Natural gas pipelines transport large quantities of gas over long distances, requiring compressor stations to maintain pressure. In permanent frost areas, cooling is necessary to prevent ground thawing and pipeline damage.
• Conventional methods use re-cooling plants with separate cooling cycles, which are expensive, largely unused during winter months, and pose safety risks due to flammable cooling agents.
• The present invention compresses gas to an excess pressure, cools it by heat exchange, and then expands it to the desired exit pressure, utilizing the cooling effect of expansion.
• This method eliminates the need for separate re-cooling plants, reducing investments and operation risks.
• The compressor station includes a compressor, heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, control units, and an electronic control system that compresses gas to excess pressure and expands it to the desired exit pressure.
• The excess pressure is selected based on the cooling capacity of heat exchange and expansion, ensuring the required temperature reduction for pipeline re-entry. The expansion can be achieved through a simple valve or an expansion turbine, recovering mechanical energy for additional efficiency.
</summary>

* The text discusses the need for vibration reduction techniques for instruments mounted on precision kinematic mounts (KM) in spacecraft due to their low inherent damping and susceptibility to high vibration levels.
* Conventional kinematic mounts, such as those shown in FIGS. 2A-2C, have limited success in protecting instruments from flight loads as they have no provisions to minimize loads transmitted to the instrument.
* The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads.
* Two preferred embodiments of the damper design are presented: a spherical damper using viscoelastic (VEM) material and a cylindrical slot damper using space qualified high damping VEM.
* The spherical damper design uses a spherical damper placed around a flexure area, which deforms under launch loads and dissipates vibration energy in the form of heat.
* The cylindrical slot damper design uses a series of o-rings placed within slots disposed about the resulting flexural hinges, which are subjected to tensile or compressive forces and dissipate vibration energy.
* The damping performance of the VEM material is frequency and temperature dependent, making it a viable candidate for damping kinematic mounts during flight.
* The proposed mounting concept uses a series of flat washers made of ISD 112 material, which can damp the six suspension modes by as much as 10% of critical modal damping, significantly reducing the flight-induced random vibration response of the instrument.
* The mounting concept can be applied to a large number of precision or optical instruments/sensors where alignment stability is important, and can be used in conjunction with truss structures or a set of three damped versions of the mount configuration to obtain a center-of-gravity mounting system with approximately uncoupled modes.
</summary>

* The invention is a large size oil shear type clutch unit for aircraft catapult systems, utilizing separate piston and cylinder means for each clutch disc segment to minimize residual drag and maximize torque transmission.
* The clutch unit includes a servo control valve and two-stage fluid amplifiers for precise fluid pressure control, and a segmented clutch disc design for easy replacement without complete disassembly.
* The auxiliary fluid supply in the clutch unit maintains a pressure in chambers in accordance with the rotational speed, causing the piston and cylinder means to positively retract and separate clutch plates from the disc segments.
* The segmental disc arrangement minimizes heat effects, and the absence of retraction springs eliminates potential malfunctions, resulting in a clutch unit with improved cooling, torque control, and minimal residual drag.

* The text describes an engine system with combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders, where exhaust gas from the combustion cylinders is delivered to the expansion cylinders for further expansion using water injection.
* The system aims to reduce the temperature of the exhaust gas to eliminate the need for a radiator and maximize thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction.
* The text also discusses various embodiments, including multiple expansion cylinders in a cascade, water cooling systems, water recovery systems, and catalytic conversion systems.

* The present invention eliminates intermetallic areas within welded assemblies by removing a precise portion of the precoating on either side of the joint before welding.
* The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer is removed must be adjusted to ensure no introduction of the precoat into the molten metal during welding and sufficient corrosion resistance after heat treatment.
* The method of the invention can be used to prepare plates, blanks, or parts for the fabrication of structural or safety parts for motorized terrestrial automotive vehicles.
* The invention provides a method for monitoring the removal of the metal alloy layer by measuring the emissivity or reflectivity of the area over which the layer is removed, and stopping the removal operation when the difference from the reference value is above a critical value.

• The present invention is a remote control system and algorithm for a mobile energy recovery system, enabling navigation and automatic operation.
• It is a SCADA system for a mobile structure that recovers energy from severe weather patterns, optimizing efficiency through data from weather observations and sensors.
• The system includes GPS, weather satellites, and telecommunications satellites for data communication, and a control and communications microprocessor system on the mobile structure.
• The microprocessor system requires input, output, and I/O functions for communicating with sensors and control circuits, including accelerometers, gyroscopes, ballast draft readings, wind sensors, fuel gauges, and GPS receivers.
• The central service facility houses a server for aggregating weather data and running a GIS, and a LAN for communication between the server and workstations running client software.
• The system uses a preferred embodiment of a worm drive or servo motor for actuating control mechanisms, such as rudder rotation, propeller rotation, or sail trim, through motor activation and solenoid control.

* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a ring element with at least three flat material ring segments joined and welded together in the circumferential direction.
* The flat material ring segments are welded along edge regions that face one another within joints, forming engagement zones that positively connect the ring segments.
* The ring element is produced from a sheet metal material and forms several rolling body guide structures arranged in the circumferential direction.
* The flat material ring segments are cut out as 120° ring segments, requiring only three weld points for joining together a ring element.
* The weld points can be formed by laser welding or pressure welding, and the ring segments can be punched out in close succession from a sheet metal strip.
* The ring segments can be welded together before or after the forming step, depending on the design of the ball bearing.
* The joint contours form undercut geometries that preliminarily couple the ring segments in the circumferential direction, and the geometric profile of the joint contours is selected for adequate coupling.
* The invention reduces production costs by significantly reducing cutting waste in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages, particularly for those with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm.

* The text describes methods and systems for obtaining and using latitude and longitude coordinates of customer service locations to improve customer service response time and efficiency.
* The systems include a technician input device, a technician server, a global positioning satellite system, and a mapping system for generating travel directions between service locations.

* The text describes a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and one control unit.
* The system combines the output signals of the two real sensors into three output signals of a virtual sensor by averaging, which represents the amplitude of the interfering field at the location of the object to be protected.
* The control unit processes the virtual sensor signals through independent control loops with various control algorithms to generate control signals for the compensation coils, which calculate the control signals from the modified signals using a 6×6 matrix L.

<summary>

• The present application is the US national phase of an international application, which claims priority to a German application.
• The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy, where a resonance signal is generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering of a resonance site in the sample.
• The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
• Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes.
• The invention allows the CARS-active scattering cross section of the target to be increased or generated, combining the advantages of multi-photon techniques with selective reactions.
• The use of bioorthogonal reactions enables a reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background in CARS microscopy.
• Copper-free click reactions, such as cyclooctynes coupled to an azide group, are particularly suitable for use in the context of the present invention.
• The method can be used in samples derived from biological sources, such as cells or tissues, without negatively affecting their bioactivity.
• The invention is schematically depicted in FIG. 1, which shows a CARS microscope, and is described in detail with reference to the drawings.
• The method involves furnishing resonance sites for the structures of the non-resonant background of the sample and correlating a signal component of the resonance signal attributable to those resonance sites with a signal component attributable to intrinsic resonance sites of the sample.

</summary>

<summary>

• The text describes a system for assessing segmentations from various sources in radiation therapy.
• The system compares segmentations from different sources, such as clinicians or software systems, to identify missing and extra volume elements.
• The missing and extra volume elements are measured and optionally weighted based on their distance from the reference volume elements.
• The system can be used for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of new imaging technology.
• The system uses electronic files, such as DICOM-RT Structure Set files, to store segmentation data.
• The system generates volume models from the segmentation files and compares them to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements.
• The system displays the results of the comparison in a user-friendly interface, allowing users to improve their segmentation skills or evaluate autosegmentation programs.
• The system can display the segmentation region differences against the underlying patient data, providing additional instructive detail.
• The system uses a metric method to measure the conformance between segmentations, which can be customized by the user.
• The system is sensitive to both overinclusive and underinclusive segmentation, and can discount the influence of errors close to the desired segmentation surface.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes an invention related to data processing systems and floating point operations.
• The floating point format allows for a larger range of numbers but requires complex and time-consuming addition and subtraction operations.
• The invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation by using a difference between a subset of signals in the operand exponent arguments.

• The invention identifies the situation where the absolute value of the difference in the arguments of the exponents is less than or equal to one (ABS{DELTA(E)} ≤ 1) or greater than one (ABS{DELTA(E)} > 1).
• When ABS{DELTA(E)} > 1, the larger operand is identified, and the subtraction operation can be performed to ensure a positive result, obviating the need for negation and normalization steps.
• When ABS{DELTA(E)} ≤ 1, the alignment of the fractions can be performed without requiring a separate step before the subtraction, and only one of the normalization or rounding step is required.
• The invention uses the difference between the six least significant position subset of the operand exponent arguments (TDELTA(E)) to initiate the computation of the final fraction result.
• The correct final fraction result is either FRACTION A or FRACTION B based on the calculation of TDELTA(E) and DELTA(E).
• The apparatus implementing the procedures includes a subtraction unit for the six least significant bit differences (TDELTA(E)), a detection and logic unit for determining the difference between the operand exponent arguments (DELTA(E)), and a shift and selection logic unit for selecting the correct procedure based on TDELTA(E) and T7DELTA(E).
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a method for collecting and tracking patient specimens, such as blood, using unique machine-readable codes on ID bands, orders, specimen containers, and badges of specimen-takers.
• The method involves inputting these codes into a computer system, determining the relationship between the patient's ID and order codes, and storing the information in a relational database. Upon completion of the specimen collection, the system generates a signal to acquire and place the specimen in the container, and stores the collection time in the database. The lab can then process the order using the information stored in the database, eliminating the need for additional paperwork or labels.

• The invention describes a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers that uses GPS technology and voice recognition to provide distance and other golf course information verbally.
• The device can be incorporated into articles of clothing or headgear, such as a golf hat, and may also memorize and compute user data to provide golf strategy recommendations.

* The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method for accurately reporting errors in logic and memory regions of integrated circuits.
* Customized design rules are created by modifying standard logic rules to reflect the needs of particular memory regions.
* Different types of memory have distinct design rules, and the invention ensures that the appropriate rules are applied to the correct regions.
* The system eliminates false errors and expedites the implementation of circuit designs into silicon form, benefiting various industries including semiconductor and liquid crystal display manufacturing.

<summary>
• The text describes an invention for using waveguide holograms (WGHs) as improved illuminators for objects, particularly holograms and spatial light modulators (SLMs).
• WGHs are thin substrate waveguides optically coupled to a light source, providing compact, rugged arrangements with high diffraction efficiencies.
• WGHs occupy less space than conventional lens illumination systems and offer advantages such as absence of stray light and high spectral selectivity.
• However, WGHs have challenges like alignment sensitivity, illumination depletion, two-sidedness, and light dispersion.
• Alignment sensitivity can be combatted by attaching the source to the waveguide or using a broad source.
• Illumination depletion can be addressed by compensating for it a priori or a posteriori.
• Two-sidedness can be mitigated by absorbing light from one side or using a mirror.
• WGHs can be used to diffract out only polarized light and use SLMs to modulate the polarization.
• The text discusses two configurations for recording WGH gratings and provides examples of illuminating SLMs and holograms using WGHs.
</summary>

<summary>

• The text describes a method and apparatus for non-destructively testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors.
• The invention aims to obtain resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of the rotor to identify defects, improve manufacturing processes, and ensure quality control.
• Prior art methods include using stator cores, destructive testing, and non-destructive techniques like rotating in a static magnetic field or using a stator fixture.
• The invention provides a novel, economical, and reliable method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors.
• The test apparatus includes a test head with a core of magnetic material, primary windings, voltage and skew pick-up coils, and a current sensor.
• The test head rotates the rotor within a magnetic field, inducing voltages and magnetic flux, which are sensed by the pick-up coils and current sensor.
• The data acquisition, processing, and control system controls testing, acquires data, and processes it to produce useful test results and rotor pass/fail determinations.
• The system includes a data processor, control processor, phase lock loop, sample and hold circuit, analog to digital system, and a winchester magnetic disk for storing statistical information.

</summary>

* The text describes a method for granting managed libraries access to native resources of an operating system while denying access to managed applications that do not have the proper digital certificate.
* The method includes the manager receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library, authorizing the request if the managed library is authorized to access the resource through a digital certificate, and the managed library sending a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host.
* The method also includes receiving a package from a networked computer system, identifying an executable in the package, and verifying managed metadata associated with the executable to ensure it includes type-safe code before allowing it to access native resources.

* The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers.
* Smart cards with rigid cores and antennas have limitations, such as susceptibility to damage from bending and increased production costs.
* The invention provides a card structure with two relatively shock-absorbing layers, two rigid outer laminate layers, and an antenna and chip enveloped between the core and bottom sheet.

* The core layer is a silica-filled polyolefin, pre-shrunk and printed with indicia, alkyd resin spids, and antennae.
* The bottom sheet is a silica-filled polyolefin, attached to the core layer with a first adhesive layer and an additional adhesive layer for bonding the IC chip.
* Two transparent polymer layers are affixed to the bonded core layer/bottom layer structure, providing mechanical strength and protecting the image-receiving layer.

* The image-receiving layer is a polymer system capable of receiving image-forming materials from a donor sheet with the application of heat, and is incompatible with the polymer of the donor sheet at the interface.
* The protective layer is a biaxially oriented polyester or other optically clear durable plastic film, protecting the image-receiving layer from damage and preventing bleeding of dye.
* The protective layer may include additional security features, such as low cohesivity polymeric layers, optically variable inks, or images readable in the infra-red or ultraviolet.
* The invention provides significant improvements in durability and ease of manufacture compared to prior art identification cards and smart cards.

<summary>

- The invention describes a method for implementing a FIFO queue in functional memories using a tree-shaped data structure, where all leaf nodes are at the same level and nodes are filled upwards.
- The tree structure meets the balance and fill conditions, ensuring that all leaf nodes are at the same level and all nodes are full except for those on the edges.
- In a preferred embodiment, a header node is added to the data structure, which contains a tree representing the middle part of the FIFO queue, a leaf node at the beginning, and a leaf node at the end.
- The header node allows for faster and less space-consuming updates, as only a constant time is required for adding or deleting records at the beginning or end, while the rest of the additions require a time logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue.
</summary>

Additionally, the header node includes a bit indicating which edge of the header node constitutes the end and which the beginning of the FIFO queue, allowing for constant-time and space inversion of the queue. The structure can be used as a double-ended queue (deque) for additions and deletions at both ends. The memory arrangement includes an actual memory, intermediate registers, a flag register for the inversion bit, and control logic for maintaining the queue.

• The present invention aims to provide EPROM devices using existing IC technologies for DRAM redundancy circuits and standard logic technologies without requiring high voltages.
• The invention utilizes DRAM storage capacitors as EPROM coupling capacitors, allowing for higher gate coupling ratios and reduced operation voltages.
• SEPROM devices, another type of EPROM, use transistor damages caused by electrical stresses to store data, offering advantages such as manufacturing using any IC technology, low cost, and security, but with longer write times and limited re-programmability.

* The text describes a method for determining the optimum values of feedback gains (P, I, and D) in a feedback control system, allowing for easy and accurate determination irreseful of the subject of control.
* The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control using that gain, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and repeating the process with a new feedback gain value until a suitable evaluation value is obtained.
* The evaluation value is calculated using the length of the error curve for proportional gain, the integral of the error for integral gain, and the integral of the absolute value of the error for differential gain.
* The method allows for the determination of feedback gains in various orders and the use of alternative evaluation functions, making it versatile and applicable to various feedback control systems.

<summary>

* The invention relates to zoom lenses for cameras with increased relative aperture and good optical performance in a minimized size.
* There is a demand for zoom lenses with a high relative aapture and reduced size for video cameras, especially those using 1/2 in. image pickup tubes.
* The fourth and fifth lens units in the zoom lens are crucial for achieving good optical performance throughout the zooming range.
* Condition (1) ensures the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth lens unit has the correct refractive power to prevent aberrations.
* Condition (2) sets the refractive power ratio for the second lens in the fifth lens unit to correct spherical aberration.
* Condition (3) sets the refractive power ratio for the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth lens unit to correct astigmatism.
* Condition (4) sets the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth lens unit to correct longitudinal and lateral chromatic aberrations.
* Condition (5) ensures the refractive power of the second lens unit is within a certain range to minimize the variation of aberrations with zooming.
* The fourth lens unit is a bi-convex lens with a strong rear surface, and the fifth lens unit is designed to correct residual aberrations.
* The invention achieves a significant reduction in the size of the zoom lens, with a total length of 9.13φ A to 9.19φ A.
</summary>

* The invention provides a method and device for detecting elementary particles, enabling both individual particle detection and signal integration without knowing count or signal rates in advance.
* The method involves discharging signals on the low-voltage side of the detector, allowing for simpler distinction of small-size signals and preventing leakage current in high-voltage cables.
* Signals are amplified in a fast amplifier for low-rate signals and integrated in a slow amplifier for high-rate signals, allowing for separate detection and integration of signals.
* Capacitors or filters are used to separate signals based on their rates, enabling adjustment for different measuring conditions and elementary particles.
* Overlapping signal rates in different amplifiers enable checks and calibrations within the signal or count rate range.
* Diamond detector material is proposed for fast charge transport at room temperature, enabling high time resolution and precise integration of signals.
* The invention can be used in various applications, including particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and electrical power engineering.
* The use of a low-voltage-side tap for signals and a support capacitor enables rapid compensation for detector discharge and prevention of leakage current in high-voltage cables.

<summary>
• The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly.
• The apparatus includes a stationary ring, a movable ring, a torque motor, and a servo motor.
• The torque motor is used to apply a predetermined torque to the driven disc assembly, while the servo motor moves the movable ring to engage and disengage the assembly.
• An electronic sensor measures the distance between the rings when the driven disc assembly is engaged.
• The torque motor is then energized to rotate the driven disc assembly against the frictional force generated by the rings.
• The movable ring is gradually moved away from the stationary ring to reduce the frictional force.
• When the frictional force decreases enough, the driven disc assembly begins to rotate under the urging of the torque motor.
• The distance separating the rings at this point is measured and compared to a standard value to determine if the driven disc assembly is excessively warped.
• The apparatus generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.
• The control system includes a microprocessor, optical encoder, position sensor, and servo motor.
• The microprocessor controls the operation of the torque and servo motors and generates signals to a display.
• The program executed by the microprocessor includes instructions for actuating the motors, reading sensor signals, and comparing difference signals to standard values.
• The apparatus automatically determines if the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances and generates external indications to the operator.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to methods and software for estimating the age of a person from their image using a contourlet appearance model (CAM) and age classification.
* The CAM algorithm extracts facial features that encode age information and distinguishes noise from meaningful signals in a given image.
* The CAM result encodes correlations between shape and texture model parameters across the training set.
* The training images are represented using Equation 6, and feature vectors are extracted and used as inputs to an age classifier and two aging functions.
* SVMs are used to construct two differently-calibrated aging functions and an age classifier based on the extracted feature vectors.
* SVMs can be extended to nonlinear decision surfaces using a kernel function and the quadratic programming problem.
* The goal in SVR is to build a hyper-plane as close to as many of the training points as possible.
* The binary classifier distinguishes youths from adults using SVMs, and the appropriate aging function is used based on the determination of the classifier.
* Estimated ages and corresponding confidence factors may be provided in various forms and transmitted to databases, security systems, or other destinations.
* The computing system contains a set of instructions for implementing any one or more aspects and/or methodologies of the present disclosure, including methods 100 and 150 and other methods.

* The present invention relates to a matrix display device for merging two images with different definitions, preserving the higher definition image's definition.
* The matrix display device includes a controller and a matrix of pixels organized in identical arrangements, with some pixels dedicated to the first image and others to the second image.
* Each arrangement can have a square of four pixels, with three pixels for the first image and one or two pixels for the second image.
* The pixels dedicated to the second image can emit a single color different from the first image's pixels.
* The controller can apply attenuation functions to the light intensity signals for the pixels of the first image based on their intensity values, preserving the higher definition image's contrast and saturation.

* The text describes a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, which includes a receptacle for a payment element and a closure to protect it.
* The payment element can be removed from the housing for various purposes, such as payment actions or bringing it to a repair shop.
* The closure effectively seals the receptacle, preventing disruptions to the connection between the payment element and electronics, and protecting against moisture and dirt particles.
* The mobile identification transmitter also includes a communication means for activating the security system and can have a credit card or debit card function when in communication with a payment system.

* The text describes methods and systems for charging toner in an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, to maintain consistent image quality during long periods of inactivity.
* The methods involve determining periods of inactivity, measuring toner charge levels, and charging toner to a predetermined level based on the difference between measured and predetermined charge levels.
* The systems include an inactivity determining section and a charging section, which work together to ensure toner is charged appropriately and maintain image quality. Additionally, the methods may use user usage patterns and predictive algorithms to optimize charging.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus for controlling bias currents to MR heads with high precision.
• MR heads require both detecting and bias currents, which are usually transmitted via a rotary transformer or slip ring.
• The invention provides a structure for independent and precise regulation of bias currents to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum using a single control signal sent from the stationary drum side.

• The invention includes a control signal generator on the stationary drum side and a decoder circuit on the rotary drum side, with a single channel rotary transformer for control signals transmitting the signals.
• The control signals include information for controlling the regenerative amplifier and recording current setting for recording heads.
• The invention also includes a regenerative integrated circuit mounted on the rotary drum, which switches among plural MR heads and requires only one control line for transmission from the stationary side to the rotary side.
• The invention prevents loss or wrong setting of data at the time of head switching by giving priority to head switching signal data and MR current control signal data in the transmission of digital data.
• The invention can be applied to various types of apparatuses, including disk apparatuses, and is not limited to digital signals or MR heads.
</summary>
